consider "fruit on a stick" skewers for picnics and barbecues. they're colorful, easy to serve and delicious. thread whole stemmed [[strawberries]] and a selection of fruit chunks onto bamboo skewers. serve with the main dish, drizzled with a little vinaigrette, or serve for a dessert unadorned.
combine equal amounts of [[strawberries]], nonfat plain or [[vanilla]] [[yogurt]] and [[milk]]. sweeten with [[honey]], if desired
2 cups pitted and sliced fresh [[apricots]] (about 6 to 8)
1 1/2 cups stemmed and halved fresh [[strawberries]] (a little more than half of 1 pint basket)
1 lb. (3 cups) frozen whole unsweetened california [[strawberries]], thawed
7&nbsp;lbs. 8oz - 1 gallon frozen sliced, sweetened california [[strawberries]], thawed
1 cup [[hominy grits|corn grits]], also called polenta or coarse-grind [[cornmeal]]
2 fresh [[beef]] (or other species) marrow bones, each at least 1 in long
6 cups chilled still spring or mineral [[water]]
4 sprigs (each 2 in. long) fresh [[mint]], slightly crushed
2 sprigs (each 2 in. long) fresh [[rosemary]], slightly crushed

just get together some [[potato]]es - any sort will do really. i had to use up some that were starting to develop shoots in my cupboard. because of this - and also because the skin on them was not really that good for leaving on - i peeled mine - but the wedges will turn out better if you don't peel the skin.

1 small head of [[cabbage]] (cut out the hard core)

spices that work for the dish are my [[ras el hanout]] blend, [[saffron]], [[turmeric]], [[cinnamon]] or [[nutmeg]] just to name a few. you can omit spices entirely and the dish will still be delicious.
